title: Bandana (USA)
description: Square bandanas: a has red ground with design in black and white; b has blue ground with design in white. Design of concentric borders, each made up of concentric diamonds, squares and ovals.

title: Vase (England)
description: Balloon-shaped body, slender neck with slight lip. deep red glaze imitating Doulton 'Rouge Flambe'.

title: Textile (Japan)
description: Long horizontal (woven in the vertical and then cut from wide fabric) panel. Ground of cream silk twill. Borders of gold fret design on dark purple twill ground. Design of realistically drawn flowers, including chrysanthemum, iris, peony, lotus, carnation, etc. brocaded in multicolored silks and beaten gold paper wrapped around silk core. Extra weft of beaten gold on flat paper strips forms fret pattern on borders.

title: Saput (man's Outer Hip Wrapper) (Indonesia)
description: Red silk saput fragment with fine lines of green, blue, and yellow creating a plaid pattern. Small brocaded shapes interspersed on plain ground. Center field of brocaded eight-pointed flowers in silver within gold diamond lattice and surrounded by gold geometric border. Gold geometric border at one end, other end cut.

title: Drawing, Design for a Magazine Cover with Geometric Abstraction
description: Design for a cover of Warp & Weft Magazine. At upper portion of the image, centered: a diamond bisected vertically and horizontally to create four triangles (black, orange, chartreuse, and white). Surrounding the diamond, various geometric shapes forming the ground in red, black, yellow, green, and gray. Light lines in graphite can be seen through the colored planes.
media: brush and gouache, graphite on board

title: Blanket (kaasa) (Nigeria)
description: Blanket composed of six narrow bands sewn together, with a braided cord attached on two sides. Patterned with bands of black and rust-red on a white ground. Brocaded with small triangles and lozenges. With tapestry bands in rust-red, yellow, and white.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Palestrina
description: Pattern in repeating connected plant motif in gray on blue and black ground.

title: Under-kimono (Japan)
description: Woman's under-kimono of lighweight silk with 4 clamped resist patterns: butterfly among leaves, in red on a white ground; 6-pointed star grid, in 2 shades of red and white; blossoms and water, in white on a red ground; and chrysanthemum and butterfly in red on a white ground. Lined with red-orange silk with gray silk crepe inside bottom and halfway up the opening. Edges faced with stencil-patterned silk. Hem and sleeves padded with unspun silk. The four red fabrics are pattern-dyed using teh itajime process, in which a folded fabric is pressed between boards, the two faces of which are carved with the same pattern. Holes in the board allow for the passage of dye.

title: Vase (England)
description: Balloon-shaped body, slender neck with slight lip. deep red glaze imitating Doulton 'Rouge Flambe'.

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Drapery swag in imitation of silk satin. Printed in grisaille with pale yellow highlights on a gray ground.

title: Huipil (Mexico)
description: Huipil made from three lengths of fabric, and each length has four selvages. The selvages are stitched together to fashion the garment with small holes remaining for the arms. Purple warp stripes are present on the edges of all three lengths. The wider central panel is patterned on one side with small animals and birds in white and purple. Center panel also has two groups of supplementary warps that are set into the middle of the fabric. Neck slit was made during the weaving process. Both ends of the supplementary warps create fringe about 2.5 inches from the bottom edge of the garment. Neck opening reinforced by widely spaced button hole stitches. Purple dye known as caracol is made from snails (plicopurpura pansa) native to the Pacific coast of Mexico. Very rare.

title: Trimming (Russia), 19th-mid-20th century
description: Lace border in white, black, red, blue and yellow. Pattern shows double-headed eagle. Scalloped edge on one side.
media: linen (white thread), silk (black, yellow, blue thread), cotton (red thread)

title: Drawing, Design for a Poster, 'Holiday Travel in North America'
description: Design for a poster encouraging holiday travel to North America. Against a black background, a white trapezoid at center, with abstracted simplified flags of the United States and Mexico partially superimposed in a vertical arrangement at right side of the trapezoid. At upper left, upper right, and lower right, ship wheels in blue, red, and yellow. The ship wheels are labeled in colors corresponding to their wheel: ALASKA, CANADA, MEXICO. Across the top of the page in green and yellow lettering: HOLIDAY; across the center of the white trapezoid, under the American flag, in blue lettering: UNITED STATES; below the white trapezoid, in yellow lettering: TRAVEL IN NORTH AMERICA.
media: brush and gouache, graphite on white paper

title: Drawing, Study for an Abstract Composition with Rectangles
description: Study for an abstract composition. Geometric design consisting of overlapping rectangles in shades of gray, blue, yellow, and black on white ground. In the upper portion of the central gray rectangle, faint horizontal lines, possibly indicating space for copy. Surrounding the composition, framing lines in graphite.
media: brush and gouache, graphite on off-white paper

title: Drawing, Study of a Geometric Abstraction
description: Study of a geometric abstraction. At center, four geometric irregular rectangular shapes in red, green, yellow, and tan layered on black ground.

title: Drawing, Study of a Geometric Abstraction
description: Study for an abstract geometric composition. At center, a black oval surrounded a white rectangle against a black and gray ground. Below the rectangle and oval, a roughly rendered torso in outline. Above and below the image, a rectangular strip of paper taped on top to the page.
media: brush and gouache, graphite on white paper

title: Drawing, Study for an Abstract Geometric Composition
description: Abstract design with geometric shapes in primary colors connected by white lines at upper left side of page on a partially black ground.
media: brush and gouache, brush and oil on masonite board

title: Drawing, Design for an Abstract Composition with Crown and Hands
description: Design for an abstract composition. At center, a faceless head with a tall white collar and an elaborate white crown. Behind, a black and blue shield. Surrounding the head on left and right, four black hands holding colorful goblets, raised as if in a toast to the royal head at center.
media: brush and gouache, graphite on cream paper

title: Drawing, Glove
description: Depiction of a worn gray and magenta glove.
media: brush and gouache on cream paper

title: Kente Prestige Cloth (Ghana)
description: Large cloth composed of narrow woven strips, each horizontally striped in many colors.

title: Status Cloth (Democratic Republic of the Congo)
description: Status cloth with a complex geometric pattern of diamonds and crosses, composed of bands of striped natural and dark brown stem stitch, and areas of natural and dark brown embroidered pile.

title: Document Case With Lid (Kenya)
description: Flat rectangular box with loop at one end, through which long copper chain passes. Box has lid that slides on and is inscribed on one side 'N A D.'

title: Print, Soaring to Success
description: Reissue of a poster designed in 1918 to promote the Daily Herald. This version printed later. On a bright yellow ground, black, white, and gray origami-like group of birds flying across the top. Text below in black: Soaring to Success! / DAILY HERALD / --the Early Bird.
media: offset lithograph on white wove paper

title: Kain Kebat (ritual Skirt) (Indonesia)
description: Kantu' woman's ritual skirt (kain kebat or bidang) with an all-over patterned field and striped borders on two sides. The field is densely covered by a pattern which can be divided into three sections where the pattern size is small, medium, and large. Each section has a variation of a vine on scroll-like diamond with the addition of what may be crawfish or plants. The borders consist of alternating stripes--ikat geometric pattern alternating with warp stripes (a zigzag variation on one side and short parallel lines on the other). In tan, dark brown, rust-red, ivory in addition to small amounts of yellow, blue-grey, red, and black.

title: Kente Prestige Cloth (Ghana)
description: Man's prestige cloth composed of twenty-three narrow woven strips stitched selvedge to selvedge. Each strip is patterned with rectangular areas of warp-faced stripes weft-faced plain weave on grouped warps, and patterned weaves with two-color complementary wefts and brocading. The pattern blocks are arranged in a checkerboard fashion. Black, blue, green, yellow, and red, with a strong yellow-orange predominating.

title: Woman's Head Wrap (Nigeria)
description: Woman's head tie of light tan and green striped fabric patterned by bands containing zigzag motifs in alternating yellow and blue. Fringed at both ends.

title: Drawing (USA)
description: Abstract cubist design of the head and neck of a figure using diagonal lines and irregular blocks of color.
media: graphite, crayon, color pencil on white wove paper

title: Kamben Geringsing (ceremonial Cloth) (Indonesia)
description: Textile in weft ikat made to imitate double ikat 'geringsing' technique. Part of a grid in which (if complete) would be composed of square placement of circles in red, purple, and white. Shows 'kota-mesir' pattern (four-pointed star, notched internal pattern, divides piece into semi-circular segments). Semi-circles depict 'wayang patlikur isi' motif (small geometric take on wayang puppet) and other figures. Motifs typical of geringsing cloths, but has uncharacteristic red border on all sides. Fringed.

title: Textile (Japan)
description: Design of birds, probably swallows, in clould-like formations and in a variety of perspectives in reserve on a dark blue ground.

title: Drawing, Design for a Plate
description: Plate design with biomorphic abstract patterns in black, blue, and metallic blue.
media: brush and gouache on cream paper

title: Bandana (Switzerland)
description: Square bandana with red ground and design in black and off-white. Field of large paisley shapes facing in alternate directions. Border of decorated trefoils.

title: Handkerchief (Switzerland)
description: Square handkerchief with a field of paisley shapes facing in alternating directions and a floral border. In black, white, red, and yellow on a turquoise blue ground.

title: Pleated Fan (possibly France)
description: Pleated fan. Printed paper leaf. Obverse; advertising the French Line with depictions of Europe and North America. Reverse: advertising the French Line with depictions of North Africa and Central America. Wood sticks.

title: Panel (India)
description: Piece is one half of a cover. Border on three sides. Two borders at top and bottom. Field of massed flowers on black background.

title: Drawing, Design for a Building
description: Architectural drawing depicting plan and elevation views of a building with an arched entryway at the left side. Ornamental details shown at center right. Illegible graphite inscription at lower right.
media: graphite, red color pencil on paper

title: Drawing, Design for a Building
description: On a single sheet of paper divided into four quadrants, architectural designs for a building depicted in both plan and elevation forms. Measurements and inscriptions throughout.

title: Fragment (Russia)
description: Pattern of floral blossoms, scalloped on one side, in red, white and blue.

title: Bowl (China)
description: Tall-sided circular 7-lobed bowl with shaped rim; inside smooth, outer surface textured; green colored glass with slight blue cast

title: Trimming (Russia)
description: Red, white and black geometric pattern.

title: Skirt Flounce (Philippines)
description: Skirt flounce with lower edge embroidered with a flat silk trimming in a pattern of arches, scallops and circles.

title: Button (France)
description: Convex button showing an eye within a wreath with the words 'Prisons de la Seine'. For use at the time of the Third republic, after 1870.On card 57

title: Buttons (USA)
description: 2 circular brass buttons; flat ; plain - for other buttons from the same set see: 1938-58-940-b/i,  which are deaccessioned.Component -a is on card 44Component -j is on card 41, was labeled as component -a

title: Trimming (Russia)
description: Pattern is large scale floral cluster in cream color and shades of brown, gold and orange.

title: Commemorative (France)
description: Panel of cream white cotton, block-printed in light red and darker red; scenes of French Army life in World War I, possibly an Alpin regiment. Design, in imitation of the old Toiles de Jouy, arranged in separate groups, in uneven horizontal rows: Soldiers firing cannon; a general on horseback, followed by two mounted officers with pennants, reviewing troups. Men wear berets; houses in background with pointed roofs; soldiers throwing hand grenades. Second row: helmeted soldiers, smoking and having soup; men in berets with Alpin stocks, leading donkeys with guns on their backs, up a hill. Red Cross tent with officer in helmet, red cross on arm, sending out dog, with red cross on side. Soldier being shaved by comrade. Both selvages present.

title: Textile (Guatemala)
description: Blue and white dyed weft alternate with bands of solid red weft on a red warp.

title: Button (USA)
description: button of cut steel with central bead surrounded by twelve smaller - for other buttons from this set see: 1938-58-940-b/t, which are deaccessioned.On card 64
